qas.question: What term is used if a master is more than 15 minutes late to a class?
How long is the typical punishment for being tardy?
When a boy is summoned to the Head Master, what is the experience called?
What is another term for rustication?
What is the longest duration a student must sign the Tardy Book?
What is the shortest duration a student would need to sign the Tardy Book?
What must a student sign if the commit a serious misdeed?
Who do students meet with if the commit the most serious misdeeds?

context: A boy who is late for any division or other appointment may be required to sign "<b7_0>Tardy Book<b7_0/>", a register kept in the <a1_0>School Office<a1_0/>, between 7.35am and 7.45am, every morning for the duration of his sentence (<a2_0>typically <b5_0><b6_0>three days<b6_0/><b5_0/><a2_0/>). Tardy Book may also be issued for late work. For more serious misdeeds, a boy is summoned from his lessons to the <b8_0>Head Master<b8_0/>, or Lower Master if the boy is in the lower two years, to talk personally about his misdeeds. This is known as <a3_0>the "Bill"<a3_0/>. The most serious misdeeds may result in expulsion, or rustication (<a4_0>suspension<a4_0/>). Conversely, should a master be more than 15 minutes late for a class, traditionally the pupils might claim it as <a0_0>a "run"<a0_0/> and absent themselves for the rest of its duration.
